## Subscription services

- Remote Ham Radio (RHR): <https://www.remotehamradio.com/>
  - \$99/year (or \$20/mo) + airtime (\$/min)
- Runs in web browser
- DEMO
  
## 1 hr/wk for better equipped station
  

```{r, echo=TRUE}
hrs_wk <- 1
fee_yr <- 99
dollars_hr <- 0.59*60 
wks_yr <- 52
(rhr_yr <- fee_yr + wks_yr*hrs_wk*dollars_hr)
```

## 3 hrs/wk for lesser equipped station

```{r, echo=TRUE}
hrs_wk <- 3
fee_yr <- 99
dollars_hr <- 0.09*60 
wks_yr <- 52
(rhr_yr <- fee_yr + wks_yr*hrs_wk*dollars_hr)
```

## FlexRadio

- SmartSDR and Smartlink (for FlexRadio)
- Windows 10, Mac OS, iOS
- DEMO

---

- Full control of radio, waterfall
- Easy set-up (largely plug-n-play)
- Can run digital modes (e.g. FT8) within iOS app itself
- Works over wifi or even cell networks
- Mac OS and iOS apps pricey

## wfview <https://wfview.org>

- Free, open-source program for "modern ICOM radios"
- Windows, Mac, Linux
- View IC-705 waterfall via wifi
- Other rigs require USB connection

## K3ROG take

- SmartSDR--but you must have a FlexRadio
- RemoteTx--but only if you have one of the supported radios
- RigPi--broader range of rigs
    - Selling my v1
- Remote Ham Radio--let someone else have the headaches
- wfview--but only for ICOM rigs

# Portable ops

## Why portable?

- Fun
- Technical/physical challenges
- Event support, emergency prep
- Jump on the NPOTA, SOTA, POTA, WMPLOTA, RaDAR bandwagon

## Considerations

- Mobility
- Bands, Frequencies, & RF Power
- Rigs(s)
- Mode(s)
- Power
- Antennas
- Logging

## Mobility

- Driving to op site or hiking/biking?

## Bands, frequencies, & RF Power

- Time of day
- CW, SSB, digital
- RF power 
    - QRP, <= 5W
    - QRP+, <= 15-20W
    - QRO, 100W
    
## Rigs

- VHF/UHF
    - HT or mobile
- HF
    - Elecraft KX2 or KX3 (QRP/QRP+)
    - ICOM IC-705 (includes VHF/UHF; QRP/QRP+)
    - Yaesu 817/818 (QRP) or 891 (100W)
    - Xiegu 5105
    - CW only like QCX+
